alfredsnippet.snippet:
(cont'd)

"... This development convincingly suggests the following analogy: Let us compare the so-called 'elementary' particles with the stationary states of an atom or a molecule. We may think of these as various states of one single molecule or as the many different molecules of chemistry. One may therefore speak simply of the 'spectrum of matter ..."
alfredsnippet.name: Phys.org Post - The Experiments of Anderson and Blackett Disproved the Notion of Elementary Particles - Part 2
